Debug Debug: BOOST Aura of Artificer Debug: BOOST Aura of Artificer - Passive (Technical) Debug: BOOST Aura of Artificer - Passive Debug: Passive Aura of Artificer - Technical Debug: Passive EnhancedDefenseCheck Debug: Passive EnhancedDefenseCheck L10 Debug: Passive Aura of Artificer - Passive (Technical) - Self
Artificer Masters of invention, artificers use ingenuity and magic to unlock extraordinary capabilities in objects. They see magic as a complex system waiting to be decoded and then harnessed in their spells and inventions. You can find everything you need to play one of these inventors in the next few sections.
Alchemist Alchemist Spells Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Alchemist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare. An Alchemist is an expert at combining reagents to produce mystical effects. Alchemists use their creations to give life and to leech it away. Alchemy is the oldest of artificer traditions, and its versatility has long been valued during times of war and peace.
Armorer Armorer Spells Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Armorer Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare. An artificer who specializes as an Armorer modifies armor to function almost like a second skin. The armor is enhanced to hone the artificer's magic, unleash potent attacks, and generate a formidable defense. The artificer bonds with this armor, becoming one with it even as they experiment with it and refine its magical capabilities.
Artillerist Artillerist Spells Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Artillerist Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare. An Artillerist specializes in using magic to hurl energy, projectiles, and explosions on a battlefield. This destructive power is valued by armies in the wars on many different worlds. And when war passes, some members of this specialization seek to build a more peaceful world by using their powers to fight the resurgence of strife. Eldritch Cannon Eldritch Cannon - Tiny You've learned how to create a magical cannon. Using woodcarver's tools or smith's tools, you can take an action to magically create a Small or Tiny eldritch cannon in an unoccupied space on a horizontal surface within 5 feet of you. A Small eldritch cannon occupies its space, and a Tiny one can be held in one hand. Flamethrower The cannon exhales fire in an adjacent 15-foot cone that you designate. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking 2d8 fire damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites any flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. Force Ballista Make a ranged spell attack, originating from the cannon, at one creature or object within 120 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 force damage, and if the target is a creature, it is pushed up to 5 feet away from the cannon. Protector The cannon emits a burst of positive energy that grants itself and each creature of your choice within 10 feet of it a number of temporary hit points equal to 1d8 + your Proficiency Bonus (minimum of +1).
Battle Smith Battle Smith Spells Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared after you reach particular levels in this class, as shown in the Battle Smith Spells table. These spells count as artificer spells for you, but they don't count against the number of artificer spells you prepare. Armies require protection, and someone has to put things back together if defenses fail. A combination of protector and medic, a Battle Smith is an expert at defending others and repairing both materiel and personnel. To aid in their work, Battle Smiths are accompanied by a steel defender, a protective companion of their own creation. Many soldiers tell stories of nearly dying before being saved by a Battle Smith and a steel defender. This companion's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> and damage increase with the <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag> of its artificer.
Steel Defender Your tinkering has borne you a faithful companion, a steel defender. You can summon it freely and give it commands in battle Force-Empowered Rend Lunge at a target to bite it Battle Ready When attacking with a magical weapon, you use your Intelligence for your attack and damage rolls instead of your Strength or Dexterity. Arcane Jolt You've learn new ways to channel arcane energy to harm or heal. When you hit a target with a magic weapon attack, you can channel magical energy through the strike to deal an extra 2d6 Force damage to the target or to restoring 2d6 hit points to a creature or construct you can see. Arcane Jolt Uses You can use this energy a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Arcane Jolt (Damage) You can deal 2d6 Force damage to a target you've hit during this turn. Expends 1 use of Arcane Jolt. Arcane Jolt (Heal) Choose one creature or object you can see within 30 feet of the target. Healing energy flows into the chosen recipient, restoring 2d6 hit points to it. Expends 1 use of Arcane Jolt. Deflect Attack The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.
Chemical Adept You achieved a profound understanding of how to use and create consumable items useful in combat. You can expend Salvaged Chemicals to craft them. Salvage Chemicals Magically extract useful chemical elements to craft consumable items useful in combat with Chemical Adept. Certain items might require more units to craft. Salvaged Chemicals You have magically extracted useful chemical elements to craft consumable items useful in combat with Chemical Adept. Certain items might require more units to craft. <LSTag Type="Image" Info="SoftWarning"/> Requires 2 units of Salvaged Chemicals Chemicals Extracted Useful chemical elements have been already extracted. Spell-Storing Item You've learned to store spells into scrolls. The magic lasts until a long rest, and you can create a number of scrolls equal to your Intelligence Modifier. Spell-Storing Item Charges
Infusion Slots Infusions Infusion Slots: [3] You've gained the ability to imbue mundane items with certain magical infusions, turning those objects into magic items. Magical Tinkering You've learned how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects. To use this ability, you must have thieves' tools or artisan's tools in hand. Flash of Genius Flash of Genius You've gained the ability to come up with solutions under pressure. When you or another creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an ability check or a saving throw, you can use your reaction to add their Proficiency Bonus to the roll. Create Spell Slot Spend Infusion Slots to unlock a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
The Right Tool for the Job Right Tool for the Job - Thieve's Tools - Display Name You've learned how to produce exactly the tool you need: You can magically create thieves Tools, a trap disarmimg kit, or a shovel. Craft: Thieves Tools Craft: Trap Disarm Kit Craft: Shovel Infusion: Enhanced Defense Infusion: Enhanced Defense Equipped This infusion gives a +1 bonus to Armor Class to armor or shield. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. Infusion: Enhanced Arcane Focus The target creature gains a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DCs. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. Infusion: Enhanced Weapon The target weapon becomes magical and grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. The bonus increases to +2 when you reach 10th level in this class. Infusion: Armor of Magical Strength Infusion: Boots of the Winding Path You can infuse a pair of boots allowing the wearer to increase their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [1] and don't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>. Infusion: Helm of Awareness Infusion: Mind Sharpener Infusion: Radiant Weapon The target weapon becomes magical and grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. It sheds a bright light in a 30-foot radius. Infusion: Returning Weapon You can infuse a weapon to grant a + 1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack. This magic weapon grants a + 1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to the wielder's hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack. Infusion: Repeating Shot This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it's used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the loading property if it has it. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack with it, allowing to attack twice per turn. The ammunition created by the weapon vanishes the instant after it hits or misses a target.
Infusion: Resistant Armor While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to one of the following damage types, which you choose when you infuse the item: acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, radiant, or thunder. Infusion: Resistant Armor (Acid) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Cold) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Fire) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Force) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Lightning) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Necrotic) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Poison) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Psychic) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Radiant) Infusion: Resistant Armor (Thunder) Infusion: Repeating Shot You are resistant to acid damage. You are resistant to cold damage. You are resistant to fire damage. You are resistant to force damage. You are resistant to lightning damage. You are resistant to necrotic damage. You are resistant to poison damage. You are resistant to psychic damage. You are resistant to radiant damage. You are resistant to thunder damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to acid damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to cold damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to fire damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to force damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to lightning damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to necrotic damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to poison damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to psychic damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to radiant damage. While wearing this armor, a creature has resistance to thunder damage.
Infusion: Bag of Holding <LSTag Type="Image" Info="Warning"/> Using it twice will create a brief portal to the Astral Plane You learned how to infuse your backpack with magical energy to transform it into a Bag of Holding that allows you to place items in an extradimensional space, greatly increasing the amount of items it can carry and disregarding weight. The Bag of Holding won't work in the Astral Plane. Using this infusion twice or placing the Bag of Holding inside another extradimensional space instantly destroys both items and opens a gate to the Astral Plane. The gate originates where the one item was placed inside the other. Any creature within 10 feet of the gate is sucked through it to a random location on the Astral Plane. The gate then closes. The gate is one-way only and can't be reopened. Repeating Shot You can shoot your ranged weapon twice at the same target. Infusion: Homunculus Servant You learn intricate methods for magically creating a special homunculus that serves you. You determine the homunculus's appearance. The homunculus is friendly to you and your companions, and it obeys your commands. Homunculus Shape: Cat Summon a cat-shaped homunculus that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Distract_Cat_Summon">Meow</LSTag> to distract your enemies. Homunculus Shape: Crab Summon a crab-shaped homunculus that can slow enemies with its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_CripplingPinch_Crab_Summon">Crippling Pinch</LSTag>. Homunculus Shape: Frog Summon a frog-shaped homunculus who can spread its <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bufotoxin_Frog_Summon">Bufotoxin</LSTag> to enemies. Homunculus Shape: Rat Summon a rat-shaped homunculus with an <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_Rat_Summon">Infectious Bite</LSTag>. Homunculus Shape: Raven Summon a raven-shaped homunculus that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_RendVision_RavenFamiliar_Summon">Blind</LSTag> enemies with its beak. Homunculus Shape: Spider Summon a spider-shaped homunculus with a poisonous <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Bite_TinySpider_Familiar">Bite</LSTag>.
Experimental Elixir Of Healing Experimental Elixir Of Healing Description Experimental Elixir Of Healing Technical Description Experimental Elixir Of Swiftness Experimental Elixir Of Swiftness Description Experimental Elixir Of Swiftness Technical Description Experimental Elixir Of Resilience Experimental Elixir Of Resilience Description Experimental Elixir Of Resilience Technical Description Experimental Elixir Of Boldness Experimental Elixir Of Boldness Description Experimental Elixir Of Boldness Technical Description Experimental Elixir Of Flight Experimental Elixir Of Flight Description Experimental Elixir Of Flight Technical Description Experimental Elixir Of Transformation Experimental Elixir Of Transformation Description Experimental Elixir Of Transformation Technical Description Produce Elemental Elixir Sturdy Armour
Replicate Magic Item Using this infusion, you replicate a particular magic items. Each item will consume an Infusion Slot and will disappear at Long Rest. Replica: Circlet of Mind Reading This magic circlet enables its wearer to read minds. Unlocks Detect Thoughts and Counterspell. Replica: Flying Boots These boots allow their wearer to fly. Replica: Crypt Lord Ring Replica: Amulet of Health Replica: Gauntlets of Giant Strength
